rooms.description: The cave mouth is rather large compared to the entrance to the east, which is quite small.  There is room enough to stand tall without too much of a problem.  Oddly the mist seems to come and go, spreading and condensing again.

rooms.name: A Turn in the Misty Cave
rooms.description: This is a small portion of what seems to be a large cave.  There is the opening of the entrance to the east distantly and the depths of the cave to the south.  The caverns seem to be filled with very much mist, probably an odd side-effect of the high humidity around and the vast amounts of mist filling the surroundings.  The cave continues east and south of here, the south leading into the depths of the cavern itself.  Dispite the apparent small size of the cave here, there is sufficient room for even a large being or two to pass with ease.

rooms.name: A Widening Section of the Misty Cave
rooms.description: This portion of the cave appears to be wider than the turn to the north. The walls are a mix of shades, mostly appearing to be tan, but also an orgy of other colors.  To the south, the walls appear to widen even more than they have here, while the north threatens to squeeze the tunnel down to oblivion.  Here, there is room for just about anything to stand nicely upright, even the largest of creatures.

rooms.name: A Very Wide Section of the Misty Cave
rooms.description: This portion of the caverns is very wide, with the ceiling extending far above.  There is certainly enough room here for anything to stand or even jump. There is a small crack in the cavern top which allows light to filter in during the daylight hours.  The mists have clung to the walls of this cave for many years, making them moist and likely slippery to the reckless.  The cave extends to a slightly narrower portion to the north, and widens further into a vast cavern to the east.

rooms.name: A Mist Filled Cavern
rooms.description: This is a large cavern extending south and east.  There is a small cave connected to this section of the cavern to the west.  There are little twisps of mist lingering all about, never seeming to completely vacate no matter what happens near them.  The humidity is just right for the mists to occasionally form and dissipate.  There is insufficient circulation for the moisture in the air to go anywhere, leaving a kind of dank and stagnant odor to the air.

rooms.name: Inside a Mist Filled Cavern
rooms.description: The cavern is quite high here, but ends abruptly to the east where the solid stone wall is.  The north is much the same, ending completely with an inpenetrable mirage of colored stone.  To the west and south the cavern carries on, vast and roomy.  The mists stretch all about, occasionally forming something more dense.

rooms.name: Inside a Mist Filled Cavern
rooms.description: The mists stand in small towers about this section of the cavern.  Most of them run from the ground only halfway up to the ceiling, but others run all the way up.  Some of the mists cut along the wall, running as smoothly as silk all over them.  The cavern is quite large, extending away north, west and south of here.

rooms.name: Inside a Mist Filled Cavern
rooms.description: The little bits of mist fill this rooms fairly regularly.  The walls are smooth and solid, supporting the ceiling quite well.  The moisture from the years has caused some little bits of moss to grow and take hold on the otherwise smooth wall.  The cavern is vast, extending north, east and south of here.

rooms.name: Inside a Mist Filled Cavern
rooms.description: This part of the cavern is as large as the rest, but has far rougher walls and floor.  It is as though there has been some destructive activity causing the stone to be broken up into pieces.  The cavern continues east and north, leading all about thoughout the rest of the interior of the moist cave.

rooms.name: Inside a Mist Filled Cavern
rooms.description: This is a large section of cavern with nothing very notable about it other than the large cavern continuing north and west.  There is, however, a small cave leading off to the east, away from the main section of the cavern.  There are some broken rocks from the wall, almost as if hit by something heavy, which are definitely out of place considering the smooth, flawlessness of the rest of the wall.

rooms.name: A Small Alcove
rooms.description: This is the entry way to a small alcove, stretching quite high into the mountain.  The dome above is quite roomy and this whole section of alcove larger than the preceeding sections of cave.  The majority of the cave is out to the west, yet a large passage leads to another section to the south.

rooms.name: A Huge Treasure Room
rooms.description: It seems hard to believe that a large creature could fit well into this enclosed space.  There are many things adorning the walls of this room. Rusted and tarnished bits of armor lay mostly in one small corner, rather tucked out of the way.  There are vast amounts of treasures here, ranging from small gems fixed in the walls to large pools of now melted and re-solidified chunks of gold.  Unfortunately many of these sheets of precious metal are so large that they would not even fit out of the cave entrance!  There is a single entrance from this cave to the north.

rooms.name: A Small Temple Entrance
rooms.description: This is the entrance to a temple of worship.  The stone pillars that line the doorway also surround the entire building, supporting the heavy marble roof.  The delicate carving of the building shows that the elements have not weathered them at all.  The roof is vaguely like a dome, leading up to a small pinnacle at its apex.  At the very top is a round globe, glowing some curious shades ranging primarily between blue and purple, but also incorporating some greens and pale yellows.  The entrance to the temple is cut through otherwise seamless stone to the east, or the trail is back to the west.

rooms.name: The Center of a Small Temple
rooms.description: This is the center of the small temple.  The ceiling stretches high above with intricate little criss-crossed carvings streaming endlessly across it. The walls are a perfect, seamless creation, supporting the heavy ceiling along with the outside pillars.  There are small little alcove-like rooms to the north, east, and south.  The entrance to the temple is to the west of here, leading back from this pristine and peaceful place to the trail beyond.

rooms.name: The North Wing of a Small Temple
rooms.description: This is a small section of the stone temple.  From the looks of the colorful carvings on the walls, this section is dedicated to the mists of the world. The cuts in the stone weave a curious tale, winding back and forth in all sorts of curious patterns.  The carvings seem to have a dull, grey glow mirroring that of a thick fog, which stands out in stark contrast from the perfect white of the stone of the temple.  There is one little carving which begs for attention and seems to be more prominent than the rest of the wall.

rooms.name: The East Wing of a Small Temple
rooms.description: This is the eastern wing of the small temple.  There are some wave-like carvings adorning the walls all around.  A beautiful azure color emanates from each of these waves, which appear to actually wash back and forth across the wall.  Above the bulk of the waves carved into the stone is a swirling tempest, lashing out toward the seas.  The center of the temple lies back toward the west.

rooms.name: The South Wing of a Small Temple
rooms.description: This alcove is dedicated to the wind and air.  There is a curious breeze swirling about the room, ruffling anything not firmly attached in place.  The walls in this section of the temple are remarkably barren compared to the rest of the structure.  There is a cloudy sort of glow from the walls.  To the north is the center of the temple.
